pullRequest.body:
Adds some miscellaneous lemmas on walks, in preparation for Tutte's theorem.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

[Thread on Tutte](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Tutte's.20theorem)

[How these lemma's would be used can be found in this commit (marked as In walk_lemmas)](https://github.com/pimotte/TutteLean/blob/28110387bcda3e7c2f4bc137f877420eed30ea49/TutteLean/Part2.lean#L43)

Hopefully the last prequisite PR, after this I expect it all to be the actual proof of Tutte's:D

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b05db078d2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22242/commits/b05db078d223429655ecd7309b0fa65d409ba23f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Connected.one_lt_dist_of_ne_of_not_adj`
`+ Reachable.one_lt_dist_of_ne_of_not_adj`
`+ Walk.exists_adj_adj_not_adj_ne`
`+ connected_induce_supp`
`+ exists_length_eq_one_iff`
`+ exists_mem_support_forall_not_adj_toSubgraph_takeUntil`
`+ reachable_induce_supp`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Taking a closer look at the proof here, I realise you can streamline and strengthen it a bit, take a look at this:

```
lemma exists_mem_support_forall_absent {u v} [DecidableEq V] {p : G.Walk u v}
    (s : Finset V) (h : {x ‚àà s | x ‚àà p.support}.Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ x ‚àà s, ‚àÉ hx : x ‚àà p.support, {t ‚àà s.erase x | t ‚àà (p.takeUntil x hx).support} = ‚àÖ := by
  simp only [‚Üê subset_empty]
  induction' hp : p.length + #s using Nat.strong_induction_on with n ih generalizing s v
  simp only [Finset.Nonempty, mem_filter] at h
  obtain ‚ü®x, hxs, hx‚ü© := h
  obtain h | h := Finset.eq_empty_or_nonempty {t ‚àà s.erase x | t ‚àà (p.takeUntil x hx).support}
  ¬∑ use x, hxs, hx, h.le
  have : (p.takeUntil x hx).length + #(s.erase x) < n := by
    rw [‚Üê card_erase_add_one hxs] at hp
    have := p.length_takeUntil_le hx
    omega
  obtain ‚ü®y, hys, hyp, h‚ü© := ih _ this (s.erase x) h rfl
  use y, mem_of_mem_erase hys, support_takeUntil_subset p hx hyp
  rwa [takeUntil_takeUntil, erase_right_comm, filter_erase, erase_eq_of_not_mem] at h
  simp only [mem_filter, mem_erase, ne_eq, not_and, and_imp]
  rintro hxy -
  exact not_mem_support_takeUntil_takeUntil' (Ne.symm hxy) hx hyp

lemma exists_mem_support_forall_absent' {u v} [DecidableEq V] {p : G.Walk u v}
    (s : Finset V) (h : {x ‚àà s | x ‚àà p.support}.Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ x ‚àà s, ‚àÉ (hx : x ‚àà p.support),
      ‚àÄ t ‚àà s, t ‚àà (p.takeUntil x hx).support ‚Üí t = x := by
  obtain ‚ü®x, hxs, hx, h‚ü© := p.exists_mem_support_forall_absent s h
  use x, hxs, hx
  suffices {t ‚àà s | t ‚àà (p.takeUntil x hx).support} ‚äÜ {x} by simpa [subset_iff] using this
  rwa [filter_erase, ‚Üê subset_empty, ‚Üê subset_insert_iff, insert_emptyc_eq] at h

lemma exists_mem_support_forall_not_adj_toSubgraph_takeUntil' {u v} [DecidableEq V] {p : G.Walk u v}
    (s : Finset V) (h : {x ‚àà s | x ‚àà p.support}.Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ x ‚àà s, ‚àÉ (hx : x ‚àà p.support),
      ‚àÄ t ‚àà s, ‚àÄ w ‚àà s, ¬¨(p.takeUntil x hx).toSubgraph.Adj t w := by
  obtain ‚ü®x, hxs, hx, h‚ü© := p.exists_mem_support_forall_absent' s h
  use x, hxs, hx
  intro t ht w hw h'
  apply h'.ne
  simp only [‚Üê mem_verts_toSubgraph] at h
  rw [h t ht (Subgraph.edge_vert _ h'), h w hw (Subgraph.edge_vert _ h'.symm)]

lemma exists_mem_support_forall_not_adj_toSubgraph_takeUntil {u v} [DecidableEq V] {p : G.Walk u v}
    {s : Set V} (hs : s.Finite) (h : (s ‚à© p.support.toFinset).Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ x ‚àà s, ‚àÉ (hx : x ‚àà p.support),
      ‚àÄ t ‚àà s, ‚àÄ w ‚àà s, ¬¨(p.takeUntil x hx).toSubgraph.Adj t w := by
  have : (filter (fun x ‚Ü¶ x ‚àà p.support) hs.toFinset).Nonempty := by
    obtain ‚ü®x, hxs, hxp‚ü© := h
    use x, by simpa [hxs] using hxp
  simpa using p.exists_mem_support_forall_not_adj_toSubgraph_takeUntil' hs.toFinset this
```
(the names aren't ideal, but hopefully you get the idea).
The last one is your original statement, and the penultimate is similar but in terms of Finset, since that usually makes this kind of proof nicer. Then instead of asserting that any two elements of s are not related in the restriction of p, we can instead say that anything in s and the restriction of p must be equal to x, or equivalently that `{t ‚àà s.erase x | t ‚àà (p.takeUntil x hx).support}` is empty. And now the induction can be done much more cleanly.

This does depend on a lemma (again I haven't given it the correct name):
```
lemma not_mem_support_takeUntil_takeUntil' [DecidableEq V] {p : G.Walk u v} {w x : V} (h : x ‚â† w)
    (hw : w ‚àà p.support) (hx : x ‚àà (p.takeUntil w hw).support) :
    w ‚àâ (p.takeUntil x (p.support_takeUntil_subset hw hx)).support := by
  rw [‚Üê takeUntil_takeUntil]
  exact not_mem_support_takeUntil_takeUntil h _ hx
```
which is a better formulation of the existing `not_mem_support_takeUntil_takeUntil`, because of the lemma `takeUntil_takeUntil`
Here are some local improvements you can make

Thanks!

maintainer delegate

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Here are some local improvements you can make

```suggestion
interpret this as being `takeUntilSet`, but this cannot be defined since we give up the knowledge
```

```suggestion
    {s : Set V} (hs : s.Finite) (h : (s ‚à© p.support.toFinset).Nonempty) :
    ‚àÉ x ‚àà s, ‚àÉ (hx : x ‚àà p.support),
      ‚àÄ t ‚àà s, ‚àÄ w ‚àà s, ¬¨(p.takeUntil x hx).toSubgraph.Adj t w := by
```
You could define `firstHit p s := p.get (iInf x \in s, p.find x)` (wishful syntax), then you could replace this lemma by a def of type `Walk u (p.firstHit s)`
Fair enough, that seemed a bit involved to me, but I guess that means it's not impossible to define. I've adapted the comment accordingly:)

```suggestion
the first encountered vertex and then use that to define `takeUntilSet`. That direction
```
Can you give some more detail on what the lemma is actually saying here: at the moment the only actual descriptor is "considers", which doesn't help the reader much!
Fixed to be more specific:)

```suggestion
    simp only [List.coe_toFinset, Set.not_nonempty_iff_eq_empty,
```

```suggestion
  obtain rfl | htx := eq_or_ne t x
  ¬∑ have : r ‚àà s \ {t} := by simp [not_and.mp htrx rfl, hr]
```
this is the usual (and cleaner) way to write this pattern!

```suggestion
    (hnadj : ¬¨G.Adj u v) : 1 < G.dist u v := 
  Nat.lt_of_le_of_ne (h.pos_dist_of_ne hne) (by
    by_contra! hc
    obtain ‚ü®p, hp‚ü© := Reachable.exists_walk_length_eq_dist h
    exact hnadj (Walk.exists_length_eq_one_iff.mp ‚ü®p, hc ‚ñ∏ hp‚ü©))
```
I'm not quite sure what you mean here, how does it make sense for at least one element of a set of vertices to be a walk?
This line break seems unintentional

```suggestion
  simp only [Set.ncard_diff (by simp [hx.1] : {x} ‚äÜ s), Set.ncard_singleton]
```

```suggestion
    use x', hx'.1, p.support_takeUntil_subset _ hx'p
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): miscellaneous walk lemmas
